intro: Distichochlamys, commonly known as the two-chambered leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-chambered calyx, which gives it its scientific name. The leaves are typically alternate and have a palmate or pinnate venation pattern. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant is often grown for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
